intro: Adelia timoriana, commonly known as the Timor starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Adelia timoriana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
